title: Add multi-language support (English, Hindi, Marathi) with language switcher

requirements.text: Create a LanguageContext (frontend/src/contexts/LanguageContext.tsx) that manages the currently selected language (English, Hindi, Marathi), persists the selection to localStorage, and exposes a useLanguage hook returning { language, setLanguage, t } where t(key) returns the translated string for the current language.

quotes: add language option and add marathi hindi and english languages

acceptanceCriteria: LanguageContext is created and exported from frontend/src/contexts/LanguageContext.tsx
Supports three language codes: 'en' (English), 'hi' (Hindi), 'mr' (Marathi)
Selected language is persisted in localStorage and restored on page reload
useLanguage hook returns language, setLanguage, and t(key) translation function
t(key) falls back to English if a translation key is missing for the selected language

requirements.text: Create a translations file (frontend/src/utils/translations.ts) containing translation strings for all three languages (English, Hindi, Marathi) covering key UI text across all pages: navigation labels (Home, About, Techniques, Farm, Shop, Cattle, Equipment, Contact, Government Schemes), hero section headlines and subheadings, section titles (e.g., 'Benefits of Organic Farming', 'Our Mission', 'Our Vision', 'Future Scope', 'Location-Based Crop Suggestions', 'Government Schemes'), common button labels (Add to Cart, View More, Explore Categories, Watch Tutorial, Sign Up, Verify OTP, Submit, Proceed to Checkout), form field labels (Name, Email, Message, Mobile Number, Full Name, Delivery Address, Phone Number), and common status/feedback messages (Order placed successfully, Incorrect OTP, etc.).

quotes: add language option and add marathi hindi and english languages

acceptanceCriteria: Translations file exports a translations object keyed by language code (en, hi, mr)
All three languages have translation entries for navigation labels
All three languages have translation entries for common button labels and form field labels
All three languages have translation entries for major section titles across all pages
Hindi and Marathi translations use proper Unicode Devanagari script

requirements.text: Add a language switcher UI component (frontend/src/components/LanguageSwitcher.tsx) that renders a dropdown or button group allowing the user to switch between English (EN), Hindi (हि), and Marathi (म) languages. Integrate it into the Header component (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx) — place it in the top-right area of the sticky header, visible on both desktop and mobile. Wrap the root App (frontend/src/App.tsx) with the LanguageProvider so language state is globally available.

quotes: add language option and add marathi hindi and english languages

acceptanceCriteria: A language switcher control is visible in the Header on all pages (including authenticated pages)
The switcher shows all three options: EN (English), हि (Hindi), म (Marathi)
Clicking a language option immediately updates all translated text across the current page
The active/selected language is visually highlighted in the switcher
The language switcher is accessible on both desktop and mobile (hamburger menu or inline)
LanguageProvider wraps the App in frontend/src/App.tsx

requirements.text: Apply the t(key) translation function from useLanguage across all major page components — Home (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx), About (frontend/src/pages/About.tsx), Techniques (frontend/src/pages/Techniques.tsx), Farm (frontend/src/pages/Farm.tsx), Shop (frontend/src/pages/Shop.tsx), Cattle (frontend/src/pages/Cattle.tsx), Equipment (frontend/src/pages/Equipment.tsx), Contact (frontend/src/pages/Contact.tsx), GovernmentSchemes (frontend/src/pages/GovernmentSchemes.tsx), Signup (frontend/src/pages/Signup.tsx), OtpVerification (frontend/src/pages/OtpVerification.tsx), Header (frontend/src/components/Header.tsx), and Footer (frontend/src/components/Footer.tsx) — replacing hardcoded English UI strings with t(key) calls so that switching language updates the displayed text without a page reload.

quotes: add language option and add marathi hindi and english languages

acceptanceCriteria: Switching to Hindi renders all major UI labels, section titles, and button text in Hindi (Devanagari)
Switching to Marathi renders all major UI labels, section titles, and button text in Marathi (Devanagari)
Switching back to English restores all English text
Language switch takes effect immediately without a page reload
Static contact information (email, phone) and product/crop names are not translated (remain in English/numerals)
No hardcoded English strings remain in the major translated UI sections

constraints: Do not modify any file under frontend/src/hooks/ (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts) or frontend/src/main.tsx
Do not modify any files under frontend/src/components/ui/
Hindi and Marathi translations must use proper Devanagari Unicode script
Language persistence must use localStorage only — no backend involvement
nonGoals: No server-side or backend translation logic
No automatic language detection based on browser locale
No translation of dynamic data such as product names, crop names, or animal names
No integration with external i18n libraries (e.g., i18next) unless already present in the project
